title: (SO) creating integration between NC and eVA - MIST and new SDWAN
description:
Description
NEW MIST alarms needs to be integrated to eVA
NEW SDWAN alarms needs to be tracjked and integrated to eVA
    ***********************************************
  need to create interface connection between NC and eVA with emphasys on alarm correlation and automation also to make sure potential in NC is used.
LEan as possible
syslog needs to be discussed with eVA
  Stakeholders are : Marcus Thielemann, Frank Buijs // Barbara Küch 
EVA: Ralf Barlösius Contact on Tel-IT side / michael duras - head of engineering
    As a customer, I want that Telekom identifies immediately, when my SD WAN service is faulty and takes proactive action so that my service is running smoothly. Therefore, alarms need to be send to the event management system so that incident tickets can be automatically created based on a set of rules and service works on the solution.
  all updates designs and progress with documentation should be tracked:
https://seu30.gdc-bln03.t-systems.com/confluence/display/SDE2E/eVA+integration
    Features Details:
•Defined alarms must be pushed via SYSLOG format from Netcracker to eVA
•Alarm processing (avoid alarm duplication / make correlation) must be done by Netcracker
•Netcracker must have a policy engine (to split between SN and eVA SYSLOG direction
•Netcracker must have a Syslog automation towards eVA
•Netcracker must be able to process and send the aligned alarms
•Netcracker must have a poll for the new set of alarms
Description
As a customer, I want that Telekom identifies immediately, when my SD WAN service is faulty and takes proactive action so that my service is running smoothly. Therefore, alarms need to be send to the event management system so that incident tickets can be automatically created based on a set of rules and service works on the solution.
Features Details:
NC must be able to preprocess alarms from CSO Juniper to events that may result in incidents that can be sent to eVA
NC must be able to send events to eVA in a way that eVA can understand and process
  Use Cases:
Events (based on alarms from CSO Juniper) are sent (as defined) with enriched information to eVA
  Pre-Conditions:
Definition of events
Juniper CSO sends alarms to NetCracker
Alarm definition for SD WAN service must be available for definition of event rules
  Acceptance Criteria:
eVA is able to receive all defined alarms in the correct form NetCracker and is able to process these alarms to open incident tickets in eTTS
Pre-Conditions:
•Align on data within alarms (based on service tree structure)
•Align on type of alarms to be sent (with Operations – Norbert Csonka)
•Discuss the exact Syslog tech structure
connection between SO and eVA
  Business impact if delayed
Event management process can't be implemented
Pro-active incident management won't be possible
It won't be possible to proactively avoid downtimes or performance issues to the service
Incidents will only be visible after service is impacted - only agzer customer raises the issue
